Experience Embedded Software Engineer Intel Corporation January 2014  – Present (1 year 8 months) Eindhoven Area, Netherlands Graduate Intern ASML February 2013  –  October 2013  (9 months) Eindhoven Area, Netherlands Master Thesis Project: “Task Execution Time Prediction for Motion Control Applications” 
 
This project aims to predict execution times by abstract modeling of applications and the hardware platform that the applications are mapped on. The model is aimed to provide predictions with at least 80-90% accuracy for motion control applications, which are run on the multi-core platform. In order to obtain desired accuracy, run-time information of application is considered; such as cache usage or/and contention in the shared resources. The effect of different parameters of the hardware platform and application are examined by simulating different applications on virtual platform (Valgrind). Moreover, distribution graphs of execution times for the tasks are obtained by varying the load on the platform. The outcomes of these experiments are abstracted in the model.
